page.title: 12HEDGEROW SURVEY,PATTISWICK
page.content: {*}The hedge was approximately 4ft. high,but had recently been cut by a mechanical cutter as the top was very rough and ragged.This section of the hedge was made of hawthorn,elder and hazel.At the bottom there were nettles,grasses,clover and brambles. When we looked at the surface of the soil we found spiders,flies,ants and a beetle.We looked in the hedge for nests without finding any.The hedge faced east.If it had faced north,one side would be shaded from the sun,so a different population of animals and plants would live in it. {*}We used a method to decide the age of the hedge devised by Dr.Max Hooper. For every proper species of tree in the hedge it is reckoned to be 100 years old. {*}We estimated the hedge to be 300 years old.
